channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Should you sleep in socks? Experts say this hack might be the secret to falling asleep faster and waking up less
Overnight tornadoes and storms leave heavy destruction in Nebraska and Iowa
item.description: A preliminary 79 tornadoes were reported Friday across six states, most occurring in Nebraska and Iowa, where homes were leveled and buildings collapsed.

item.title: 'We expect Powell to make a hawkish pivot'—Fed meeting to headline busy week for global markets
item.description: "At the minimum, he’ll likely indicate the median FOMC participant now expects ‘less’ cuts this year."

item.title: White House plans to limit Biden's graduation speeches as campuses erupt in protests
item.description: Biden is scheduled to speak at Morehouse College and the U.S. Military Academy at West Point, while Harris is slated to give a speech at the Air Force Academy.

item.title: Police bust 'very sophisticated' burglary ring that used Wi-Fi jammers to stea $4 million in jewels
item.description: The Providence-based theft crew broke into homes in 25 Massachusetts communities between July 21, 2018 and March 30.

item.title: Putin likely did not directly order Navalny’s killing, U.S. intelligence agencies conclude
item.description: Sources said the assessment doesn't absolve Putin of ultimate responsibility for Navalny's fate, only that Putin likely didn't call for his killing at the time.

item.title: U.S. Secretary of State buys Taylor Swift album in China to wrap up key visit after warning on EV overproduction, Russia
item.description: Antony Blinken stopped at a Beijing record store where he bought albums by Taylor Swift and Chinese rocker Dou Wei in a symbolic nod to cross-cultural exchanges.

item.title: Paramount CEO Bob Bakish could be out as soon as Monday as Skydance merger talks continue
item.description: Paramount Global reports its quarterly earnings Monday.

item.title: It's time to talk about the 'dirty word' on Wall Street as 'whiffs of stagflation' intrude on markets, chief strategist says
item.description: "And that's why it was kind of shocking to see bond yields rise on a day where GDP was a big miss."

item.title: ‘This is a unique time’: ARK Invest’s chief futurist tackles tech innovation from AI to robotics
item.description: ARK Invest's chief futurist Brett Winton lists five groups in the heart of tech innovation.
